87083.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"e8o2b","text":"Here, each analyte can be evaluated in each sample.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7jbs2","text":"Check that all peaks have integrated and that there are peak areas for each analyte - reassign retention time if it is not quite picking the peak and visually assess peak area and retention time to ensure that the correct peaks have been integrated.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"co4qf","text":"Check the calibration curves for accuracy (\u003c20%) and exclude those points that are outwith. Ensure there are a minimum of 6 points in each calibration curve and that they have a regression coefficient R\u003e0.99.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

87083.section: Transferring TraceFinder alphanumeric data into Excel to summarise results
87083.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"fu559","text":"Copy the sample names from one of the analyte tabs, and paste into the summary tab. Then return to the Analyte tab and copy the '[Analyte name] ng' column. Repeat this copying of the [Analyte name] ng column until all analytes in the excel file, have been copied. This results in a Summary table that is the major results of the analysis in terms of concentration.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

87083.section: Transferring TraceFinder alphanumeric data into Excel to summarise results
87083.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8otrh","text":"If the calibration curve units are ng and the sample extracted has been a volume, add a column ahead of all analyte concentrations, include the volume extracted for each sample and then use this column to calculate the ng/mL amount by dividing the ‘calculated amount’ by the volume (uL) and multiply by 1000 to give the ng/mL amount of each analyte. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

87083.section: Transferring TraceFinder alphanumeric data into Excel to summarise results
87083.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"82dg9","text":"Save the excel file in the appropriate folder.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

description: {"blocks":[{"key":"ejd13","text":"Tracer glucose and tracer glycerol is used to assess glucose kinetics and turnover.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2rql9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ehkgb","text":"Here we have improved upon existing gas chromatography mass spectrometry (GC-MS) methods for the quantitation of glucose, D2-glucose, glycerol and D5-glycerol in plasma. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1b2oo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b1v4","text":"Plasma samples (200 μL) were extracted by automated 96-well protein precipitation (PPT+) using acetonitrile and as an organic solvent, carried out on an Extrahera automated sample handler.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":95,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6nt1u","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"23v8u","text":"Extracts were derivatised using acetic anhydride to form glucose pentacetate and glycerol triacetate, with internal standard butanetriol and 13C6-glucose pentacetate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":141,"length":2},{"style":"sub","offset":144,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"en7q0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fdhkj","text":"Derivatives were separated on a GC 9000 on an TG-WAX MS column (30 m x 0.25 mm; 0.25 μm) and a carrier gas mobile phase of helium. The run time was 30 minutes, followed by mass spectral analysis on a Quantum tandem quadrupole mass spectrometer (ThermoFisher) operated in chemical ionisation mode.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":32,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8ak64","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e542h","text":"This method has been used to analyse glucose, D2-glucose, glycerol, D5-glycerol. Validation demonstrates that this method is sensitive, specific, and suitable for simultaneous measurement of glucose and glycerol in  plasma (200 µL) and glucose turnover","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eofgc","text":"Preparation of Calibration Standard Solutions","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":45}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d20hf","text":"Pipette volume of each solution into glass vials as defined below.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cj5fe","text":"Note: Amount of glucose is 50 x that of d2 glucose  and 200x that of Glycerol and d5-glycerol","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eh0gk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"61hfm","text":"•\tGLUCOSE A - 50 mg/mL Glucose + 1 mg/mL d2-glucose (need 100 µL max) so – Prepare 2 mg/mL d2-glucose in water. Weigh out 50 mg glucose in a 7 mL glass vial. Add 500 µL x 2 mg/mL d2-glucose + 500 µL water to the 50 mg glucose. This dilutes the 2 mg/mL d2-glucose 1:1 and results in 1 mL of a 50 mg/mL Glucose/ 1 mg/mL d2 glucose solution. Vortex thoroughly.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":2,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"75lev","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7rmt6","text":"•\tGLUCOSE B - 5 mg/mL Glucose + 0.1 mg/mL d2-glucose: Add 100 µL of Glucose A solution to 900 µL water in a 1.75 mL glass vial. Vortex thoroughly.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":2,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8olmd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cl6pg","text":"•\tGLUCOSE C - 0.5 mg/mL Glucose + 0.01 mg/mL d2-glucose: Add 100 µL of Glucose B solution to 900 µL water in a 1.75 mL glass vial. Vortex thoroughly.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":2,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d8ti0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"k3n7","text":"•\tGLYCEROL A – 250 µg/mL (Glycerol + d5-glycerol): Prepare by weighing out 2 mg glycerol and 2 mg d5-glycerol in separate 7 mL glass vials. Add 4 mL water to each to produce 500 µg/mL solutions of each. Vortex thoroughly. Combine 500 µL of the 500 µg/mL glycerol solution and 500 µL of the 500 µg/mL d5-glycerol solution in a 1.75 mL glass vial giving a combined 250 µg/mL solution. Vortex thoroughly.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":2,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8k15i","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9a810","text":"•\tGLYCEROL B – 25 µg/mL (Glycerol + d5-glycerol): Add 100 µL of Glycerol A solution to 900 µL water in a 1.75 mL glass vial. steps.section: Extraction of glucose, glycerol, D2-glucose and D5-glycerol from human plasma
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3nvlu","text":"Perform protein precipitation of samples and standards in a 96-well plate with  e and 600 μL acetonitrile","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":79,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"b395a","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3vpbg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"200","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6fnua","text":"Turn on Air Compressor. steps.section: Extraction of glucose, glycerol, D2-glucose and D5-glycerol from human plasma
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"784o1","text":"Place a labelled PPT+ plate in deck position 3. Check plate orientation is correct.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Extraction of glucose, glycerol, D2-glucose and D5-glycerol from human plasma
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"b0bk6","text":"Place a labelled Waters 2 mL 96-well collection plate is in carousel position A","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Extraction of glucose, glycerol, D2-glucose and D5-glycerol from human plasma
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"ajp3s","text":"Take a Biotage 2 mL deep well collection plate and label with batch details. Add 200 uL water to blank wells according to plate map designed. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Extraction of glucose, glycerol, D2-glucose and D5-glycerol from human plasma
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2hio0","text":"Select and run the PPT+ method. It will load 600 uL acetonitrile onto the PPT+ plate. Then it will transfer the contents of the sample plate column by column onto the acetonitrile loaded PPT+ plate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Extraction of glucose, glycerol, D2-glucose and D5-glycerol from human plasma
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"26dle","text":"Add required amount of water and Glucose and Glycerol standards to the calibration standard wells according to the table in the PREPARATION OF CALIBRATION STANDARDS section. Due to the small volumes of standard being pipetted, ensure that the standard is pipetted INTO the water. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Extraction of glucose, glycerol, D2-glucose and D5-glycerol from human plasma
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"32d79","text":"Add 200 uL of each plasma sample from the sample tubes to the appropriate well plate positions","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Extraction of glucose, glycerol, D2-glucose and D5-glycerol from human plasma
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"fs9oa","text":"Using the Gilson Repetman and a 1 mL tip, add 20 uL of the internal standard solution to wells except for Double Blank and Solvent Blank wells. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Extraction of glucose, glycerol, D2-glucose and D5-glycerol from human plasma
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3s433","text":"Seal the plate using a Merck well plate sealing film and shake the plate on a plate shaker for 2 mins to ensure that the standards and internal standards are sufficiently mixed.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Extraction of glucose, glycerol, D2-glucose and D5-glycerol from human plasma
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4v925","text":"Remove the plate seal and place the sample plate on the deck of the Extrahera in position 4.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Extraction of glucose, glycerol, D2-glucose and D5-glycerol from human plasma
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2tde3","text":"The robot will leave the sample to interact with the acetonitrile for 20 minutes, before applying positive pressure onto the PPT+ plate and collecting the eluent of the sample in the Waters 2 mL deep well 96-well plate. Check the full volume has been eluted into the plate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Transfer of extracts to glass vials for derivatisation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7quof","text":"Transfer eluent to individually labelled glass vials and dry down on a Dry Block under nitrogen gas at 40C, gas flow at 25 L/min. Typical dry down is 35-40 mins. Do not overdry. Store at -20C at this stage if needed.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
